columns.description: Full name of organisation, this could be a repeat of the parent department or alternatively the name of an NDPB, Agency, etc.

columns.name: department

columns.name: unit

columns.description: An area/workstream name used within your organisation to define the different areas of the organisation, e.g. Human Resources, Corporate Services, Private Office Group. This should be defined at a level that best represents your organisational structure, e.g. DG or DD level.

columns.name: organisation
columns.title: Organisation
columns.description: Full name of organisation, this could be a repeat of the parent department or alternatively the name of an NDPB, Agency, etc.

columns.name: job-title
columns.title: Generic Job Title
columns.description: The generic job title for the particular grade.

columns.name: grade
columns.title: Grade
columns.description: The level of grade the posts carry.

columns.name: minimum-pay
columns.title: Payscale Minimum (£)
columns.description: The minimum salary of the particular grade payscale.

columns.name: maximum-pay
columns.title: Payscale Maximum (£)
columns.description: The maximum salary of the particular grade payscale.

columns.name: id
columns.title: Post Unique Reference
columns.description: Individual reference code assigned to a post within an organisation.
columns.comment:
Cannot be XX.

	If a post is eliminated, the reference must be as well and not re-used.

	If a person does not have a post but is still being paid by the organisation then ‘0’ (zero) should be used.

	Can only be duplicate for people that share a role.

columns.name: name
columns.title: Name
columns.description: Postholder’s name for SCS 2 and above.
columns.comment:
Name not disclosed for SCS 1.

	If the name is not disclosed write ‘N/D’.

	If the post is vacant write ‘vacant’.

	If the post has been eliminated write ‘eliminated’.

columns.name: grade
columns.title: Grade
columns.description: The equivalent SCS grade for the post.

columns.name: job-title
columns.title: Job Title
columns.description: The generic title for the grade, e.g. Permanent Secretary, Chief Executive, Director General, etc. or the area of responsibility, e.g. Strategic Communications, Human Resources, Operations, etc.
columns.comment:
Cannot be blank or ‘N/D’.

	If post reference is ‘0’ write ‘Not in post’.

columns.name: job-function
columns.title: Job/Team Function
columns.description: Short description of the core purpose of the job/team.
columns.comment:
Should not be a list of objectives.

	Meaningful to the taxpayer/user.

	Plain English, try to avoid using acronyms.

	If the post reference is ‘0’’, write ‘N/A’.

columns.name: unit
columns.title: Unit
columns.description: An area/workstream name used within your organisation to define the different areas of the organisation, e.g. Human Resources, Corporate Services, Private Office Group. This should be defined at a level that best represents your organisational structure, e.g. DG or DD level.

columns.name: phone
columns.title: Contact Phone
columns.description: Contact telephone number for the postholder. This can include a group contact number instead of an individual’s number.
columns.comment:
UK or international telephone number.

	If post is vacant or eliminated write ‘N/A’.

	If name has been withheld, then a group telephone number must be entered.

columns.name: email
columns.title: Contact E-mail
columns.description: Contact email address for postholder, either an individual or group departmental email address.
columns.comment:
If post is vacant a group email can still be provided or alternatively write ‘N/A’.

	If post is eliminated write ‘N/A’.

	If name has been withheld, provide a group email address.

columns.name: reports-to
columns.title: Reports to Senior Post
columns.description: The corresponding unique post reference for the person the post/postholder reports to.
columns.comment: For the most senior person in the organisation this should be shown as `XX`.

columns.name: salary-of-reports
columns.title: Salary Cost of Reports (£)
columns.description: An accumulative total cost of SCS 1 staff and below that report to a post unique reference at SCS 1 level or above.
columns.comment:
Staff costs should only be included in one group, i.e. this is not a cumulative total as you go up the hierarchy.

	If an SCS 1 has a team of 5 staff or less, they should be rolled into a larger team within their reporting area or to a more senior member of staff.

	If an SCS 2 or above has a small team of 5 or less, these staff can be rolled into another within that particular reporting structure.

	If no reports then write ‘0’.

columns.name: fte
columns.title: FTE
columns.description: Indicates whether this is a full or part time post.

columns.name: pay-floor
columns.title: Actual Pay Floor (£)
columns.description: The salary cost of an SCS 2 or above rounded down to the nearest 5000.
columns.comment:
SCS1 salary should not be disclosed.

	If post is vacant, write ‘0’.

	If SCS 1 post write ‘N/D’.

columns.name: pay-ceiling
columns.title: Actual Pay Ceiling (£)
columns.description: An automatically completed cell with pay ceiling based as £5k above figure entered as ‘actual pay floor’.

columns.name: profession
columns.title: Profession
columns.description: A list of professional/occupational groups based on Professional Skills for Government standard CS professions.
columns.comment: You will need to select the closest description to the teams main function.

columns.name: notes
columns.title: Notes
columns.description:
Can be used to add additional supporting text to line detail, e.g.

	  * Parent Dept paying part/all of a secondee’s salary
	  * Indicate parental leave
	  * Date a post was eliminated
	  * Date a post became vacant
	  * Indicate a job share post
	  * A previous role title if changed
	  * A post has altered since last organogram due to split of duties or merger of posts
	  * Additional duties held by a person that does not report to their normal line management
	  * A small SCS team that has been reported within a larger team
	  * Finish date of assignments for those that work on a project by project basis

	There may be other instances where additional clarity will help read across from the current organogram to previous ones or from one department’s organogram to another.

columns.name: unit
columns.title: Unit
columns.description: An area/workstream name used within your organisation to define the different areas of the organisation, e.g. Human Resources, Corporate Services, Private Office Group. This should be defined at a level that best represents your organisational structure, e.g. DG or DD level.

columns.name: reporting-to
columns.title: Reporting Senior Post
columns.description: The corresponding unique post reference for the SCS person the junior posts reports to.

columns.name: grade
columns.title: Grade
columns.description: The level of grade the posts carry.

columns.name: job-title
columns.title: Generic Job Title
columns.description: The generic job title for the particular grade.

columns.name: posts
columns.title: Number of Posts in FTE
columns.description: The number of posts, expressed in FTE, within the Unit that carry the particular grade and job title.

columns.description: A list of professional/occupational groups based on Professional Skills for Government standard CS professions.
columns.comment: You will need to select the closest description to the teams main function.
